title: Georgetown County clean up underway after Debby leaves minor impact
message:
GEORGETOWN, S.C. (WCBD) — Tropical Storm Debby made a second landfall around 2 a.m. near Bulls Bay and made its way up the coast.
Despite moving through Georgetown County, residents in the area were spared from most of the significant impacts we saw here in the Lowcountry.
After bracing for significant rain, flooding, and winds, officials in Georgetown County are breathing a sigh of relief.
The original forecast was bleak, and we prepared for that and were prepared for anywhere from 20 to 30 inches of rainfall in Georgetown County.
We received a fraction of that over the past several days,” said Brandon Ellis, Emergency service director for Georgetown County.
event_breakdown: Tropical Storm Debby made landfall around 2 a.m. near Bulls Bay, S.C.

title: Japan issues first  megaquake  warning after 7 . 1 - magnitude tremor
message:
Japan issued its first warning on Thursday about the possibility of a long-feared “megaquake”.
The earthquake occurred off the coast of Miyazaki Prefecture on the main island of Kyushu at 4.42pm local time at a depth of about 29km, according to the Japan Meteorological Agency.
Police in Miyazaki Prefecture said there had been 10 reports of damage.
Credit: APEarlier, officials issued a tsunami advisory following Thursday morning’s quake, warning residents to immediately leave coastal areas of Kochi and Miyazaki prefectures until the warning is lifted.
Police in Miyazaki Prefecture said there have been some reports of landslides and some traffic lights have stopped working.
event_breakdown: Japan issued a warning on Thursday about the possibility of a long-feared “megaquake”, while officials issued a tsunami advisory after Thursday morning’s quake, warning residents to immediately leave coastal areas of Kochi and Miyazaki prefectures. Police in Miyazaki Prefecture said there were some reports of landslides as well as some traffic lights that have stopped working.

title: Storm Debby makes second landfall in South Carolina
message:

Rainfall totals could reach 38cm in southeastern North Carolina and 25cm in parts of Virginia.

According to officials, the heavy rain could cause flash flooding and river flooding, as well as possible landslides and mudslides in the mountainous areas of the Carolinas and Virginia.

title: Pray For Japan : Major Earthquake Strikes Causing Tsunami Advisory | Positive Encouraging K - LOVE
message:
TOKYO (AP) — A powerful earthquake struck off Japan’s southern coast on Thursday, triggering a tsunami advisory that urged residents to stay away from the coastline.
The quake most strongly shook Nichinan city and nearby areas in Miyazaki prefecture on Kyushu island.
The tsunami advisory was lifted from most coastlines except those along the Miyazaki prefecture.
Police stand outside a damaged building following an earthquake in Miyazaki, western Japan, Thursday, Aug. 8, 2024.
Earthquakes in areas with nuclear power plants have been a major concern since a massive earthquake and tsunami in March 2011 triggered the Fukushima nuclear disaster.

title: Gut wrenching : Madison County campground experiences major flooding following Debby
message:
MADISON COUNTY, Fla. (WCTV) - Flooding from Debby is threatening homes and businesses as water continues to rise days after the storm soaked the Big Bend.
Ragans Family Campground in Madison County was forced to shut down temporarily due to excessive flooding, with picnic tables, benches and grills partially submerged in the waters.
Campground manager Edward Carlick said the campground experienced minor flooding during Hurricane Debby, which he thought would be the worst of it.
“It was gut wrenching, you know, and it’s a lot of work,” Carlick said.
He said the flooding within the park intensified Wednesday night, and he expects it could get worse before it gets better.

title: Japan PM Kishida may cancel key Central Asia visit over earthquake warning
message:
The Japan Meteorological Agency on Thursday warned of the “relatively higher chance” of another major earthquake near Japan’s Pacific coast, following one of magnitude 7.1 off the southwestern island of Kyushu earlier in the day.
The seismic activity prompted the Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) to issue a tsunami advisory.
Please do not enter the sea or approach the coast until the warning is lifted,” the Japan Meteorological Agency said in a post on X on Thursday.
Japan is one of the world’s most earthquake-prone areas as it is situated along the “Pacific Ring of fire" which is the “most active” earthquake belt globally.
Japan is located on the joint of four different plates, with the Pacific plate and the Philippine plate to the east and the North America plate and the Eurasian plate to the west.
event_breakdown: Japan's Meteorological Agency (JMA) warned Thursday of increased seismic activity in the area after a 7.1-magnitude earthquake off the coast of Kyushu Island in the Pacific Ocean. The agency declared a tsunami advisory for the sea near the island in Japanese waters butcancelled the advisory after no tsunami was detected.

title: Billion Dollar Disasters : 19 So Far in 2024
message:
According to experts from NOAA’s National Centers for Environmental Information, there were four new billion-dollar disasters confirmed for the month, putting the U.S. at 19 for the year.
The four new events included a severe weather outbreak in the southern U.S. in mid-May, western wildfires in New Mexico, late June severe weather in the northeast, and Hurricane Beryl.
Of the 19 $B weather and climate disasters this year, 15 have been severe storm events, two wildfire events, one tropical cyclone, and one winter storm.
These disasters consisted of 15 severe storm events, one tropical cyclone event, one wildfire event, and two winter storms.
According to NCEI:"The U.S. has sustained 395 separate weather and climate disasters since 1980 where overall damages/costs reached or exceeded $1 billion (including CPI adjustment to 2024).
event_breakdown: 19 weather and climate events were reported to the U.S. National Centers for Environmental Information this year, including the four events from May through June.

title: City leaders react to flood water study in Punta Gorda
message:
A trend of flooding in Punta Gorda has now triggered a plan for a floodwater study.
As the water rose, flooding the streets of Punta Gorda, homes like Debbie Wilson-Clay’s looked more like islands.
This is the reality for downtown Punta Gorda neighbors, holding their breath during any above-average rain and when the water goes down and feeling their distress falls on deaf ears.
I wouldn’t want to be living where I hold my breath every time a storm is coming,” said Melissa Reichert, the Punta Gorda Assistant City Manager.
If the drains’ design issues are problematic, as many neighbors believe, Reichert says the study will identify them.

title: Flash drought developing . Hot , dry & a new wave in the Atlantic .
message:
We’re starting to see drought conditions creeping back across Louisiana after nearly two weeks without rainfall in some locations.
Essentially, a flash drought occurs when abnormally high temperatures & little to no rainfall combine to rapidly dry out soil moisture causing drought conditions.
10% of Louisiana is now experiencing abnormally dry conditions, including part of the Northshore.
The latest outlook from the National Hurricane Center is highlighting a disturbance in the central Atlantic.
Conditions look favorable, and this disturbance has growing model support from reliable forecast guidance into a tropical storm or hurricane.
event_breakdown:
1. The drought conditions across Louisiana are becoming a concern as there has been no rainfall in some locations for the past two weeks.
2. A flash drought occurs when abnormally high temperatures and little rainfall cause soil moisture to rapidly dry out. 10% of Louisiana is currently experiencing abnormally dry conditions.
3. A disturbance in the central Atlantic is currently being monitored by the National Hurricane Center. Conditions are favorable for this disturbance to develop into a tropical storm or hurricane.

title: Tropical remnants to bring sprawling rains to Atlantic Canada
message:
A taste of the tropics will spill north of the border this weekend as the remnants of Tropical Storm Debby bring widespread rain to Atlantic Canada.
Forecasters will closely watch the track of the system, as a shift to the south could bring heavier rain into more populated areas.
While the bulk of the heavy rain is expected across eastern Ontario and southern Quebec, the Atlantic provinces aren’t out of the woods when it comes to heavy rainfall.
A slight shift toward the south could bring heavier rain closer to populated areas throughout the Maritimes.
Stay with The Weather Network for the latest on conditions across Atlantic Canada.

title: N . J . storm update : Latest forecast , wind , flood , surf alerts as Debby remnants move closer
message:
The National Weather Service has started issuing a series of alerts as New Jersey braces for strong gusty winds, heavy downpours, severe thunderstorms and isolated tornadoes from the remnants of Tropical Storm Debby on Friday.
The National Hurricane Center said Debby is now moving toward the north-northwest at a speed of about 10 mph.
“A faster northward or north-northeastward motion is expected during the next day or two,” the agency said in its latest public storm advisory.
Tropical Storm Debby has lost some of its wind strength, so it was downgraded to a tropical depression shortly before 5 p.m. Thursday.
Hudson County is under wind advisory from noon to 11 p.m. Friday, with southerly winds of 15 to 25 mph and gusts up to 50 mph expected.

message:

Peggy Butler, a resident of Tremont Park for 40 years described what she calls a ‘horrifying’ couple of days.

title: JMA issues megaquake advisory for 29 prefectures | The Asahi Shimbun : Breaking News , Japan News and Analysis
message:
The Japan Meteorological Agency issued its first megaquake advisory, covering 707 municipalities from Okinawa to Ibaraki prefectures, after a magnitude-7.1 earthquake struck off Miyazaki Prefecture on Aug. 8.
Conditions were met for the JMA to issue what is called the Nankai Trough Earthquake Extra Information.
A JMA panel meeting was convened, and the experts issued the megaquake advisory, the second highest alert, for the first time since the system was introduced in November 2017.
In 1854, the magnitude-8.7 Ansei Nankai Earthquake occurred only about 32 hours after the magnitude-8.6 Ansei Tokai Earthquake.
The municipalities covered by the megaquake advisory can be seen from the QR code below, available only in Japanese.

title: Japan PM Fumio Kishida Cancels Central Asia Trip Amid Megaquake Warnings
message:
The Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) issued the advisory on Thursday after eight people were injured by a tremor of magnitude 7.1 in the south.
Kishida was due Friday to travel to Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan and Mongolia and had planned to attend a regional summit.
"The likelihood of a new major earthquake is higher than normal, but this is not an indication that a major earthquake will definitely occur," the JMA said.
The government has previously said a megaquake has a roughly 70 percent probability of striking within the next 30 years.
In 2011, a mammoth 9.0-magnitude undersea quake off northeastern Japan triggered a tsunami that left around 18,500 people dead or missing.

title: Japan PM cancels overseas trip after experts issue  megaquake  warning | Japan

Public broadcaster NHK said Kishida’s overseas trip had been cancelled so that he could prepare for any eventuality.
The meteorological agency’s megaquake advisory warned that “if a major earthquake were to occur in the future, strong shaking and large tsunamis would be generated”.
In 1707, all segments of the Nankai Trough ruptured at once, unleashing an earthquake that remains the nation’s second-most powerful on record after the March 2011 earthquake along the north-east coast.
In the worst-case scenario, the disaster would kill 300,000 people, with some experts estimating a financial hit as high as $13tn.

title: Japan PM scraps overseas trip after  megaquake  advisory
message:
Japan's Prime Minister Fumio Kishida on Friday cancelled a trip to Central Asia after earthquake scientists warned the country should prepare for a possible "megaquake".
The Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) issued the advisory on Thursday after eight people were on injured by a tremor of magnitude 7.1 in the south.
"The likelihood of a new major earthquake is higher than normal, but this is not an indication that a major earthquake will definitely occur," the JMA said.
In 2011, a mammoth 9.0-magnitude undersea quake off northeastern Japan triggered a tsunami that left around 18,500 people dead or missing.
It sent three reactors into meltdown at the Fukushima nuclear plant, causing Japan's worst post-war disaster and the most serious nuclear accident since Chernobyl.

message:
A tropical wave is being watched by the National Hurricane Center as it spins over the Eastern tropical Atlantic.

By the beginning of next week, slow development of this system is possible as it nears the Lesser Antilles.
Eventually, the system could turn more northerly thereafter as a ridge of high pressure breaks down near Bermuda.
Hurricane season runs through Nov. 30.

title: 5 . 3 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Tokyo After Japan Issues Megaquake Alert
message:
The quake shook buildings in Tokyo following the warning.
A magnitude-5.3 earthquake hit Tokyo and surrounding areas on Friday evening, the Japan Meteorological Agency said, a day after the government issued a first-ever advisory about the risk of a huge earthquake on the country's Pacific coast.
The government issued an emergency warning of a strong tremor for the capital city and Kanagawa, Saitama, Yamanashi and Shizuoka prefecture, without a tsunami alert.
The quake shook buildings in Tokyo following the warning.
(Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is published from a syndicated feed.)
event_breakdown: Japan was hit by a magnitude-5.3 earthquake on Friday, the Japan Meteorological Agency said, a day after the government issued a first-ever advisory about the risk of a huge earthquake on the country's Pacific coast.

title: Japan Megaquake Warning : How Prepared is the Country ?
message:
Japan, long renowned for its earthquake preparedness, is facing heightened anxiety following a recent 7.1-magnitude tremor off its southern coast.
This earthquake, which triggered a tsunami advisory, has led the Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) to issue a rare and alarming megaquake warning, prompting concerns about the nation’s readiness for a potential massive quake.
On August 8, 2024, a powerful 7.1-magnitude earthquake struck off the southern island of Kyushu, causing significant tremors across the region.
Megaquake Warning IssuedIn the aftermath, the JMA issued its first-ever megaquake warning, citing an increased risk of a major earthquake occurring along the Nankai Trough, a seismic zone running along Japan’s Pacific coast.
Following the devastating 1923 Yokohama earthquake, Japan implemented rigorous seismic building codes, ensuring that structures are designed to withstand significant tremors.
event_breakdown: Japan, August 8, 2024 - A 7.1-magnitude earthquake strikes off the southern island of Kyushu, causing significant tremors across the region. The Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) issues its first-ever megaquake warning.

title: Tropical Storm Debby makes second landfall bringing widespread flooding to N . C ., Virginia
message:
Tropical Storm Debby made a second landfall in South Carolina on Thursday, knocking out power to more than 131,000 North Carolina homes and businesses while also causing widespread flooding.
Rain from Debby is being blamed for the deaths of at least six people — four in Florida, including two children, and the others in Georgia and North Carolina.
North Carolina Gov.
According to poweroutage.us, 131,948 customers were without power in North Carolina, and in South Carolina 8,406 were without power.
The heaviest outages in North Carolina were concentrated in Mecklenburg County, with significant outages in Chatam, Gaston and Forsyth counties.

message:

One person was found dead in a home damaged by the Lucama tornado, Wilson County spokesperson Stephen Mann said.

title: Tropical Wave in Atlantic Could Develop into Named Storm Ernesto
message:
The National Hurricane Center (NHC) is closely monitoring a tropical wave in the Atlantic that shows potential for development.
Located several hundred miles west-southwest of the Cape Verde Islands, this system could become the next named storm, Ernesto .
While the storm’s track remains uncertain, forecasters believe it may strengthen into a tropical depression or even a hurricane.
Tropical Storm Debby, which recently made landfall in South Carolina, has weakened into a post-tropical cyclone.
Stay informed and prepared during this active hurricane season, and heed local weather advisories for your safety.

title: Rare Tornado warning issued for US Capitol ; Washington DC put on shelter - in - place alert ; Airport delays
message:
Storm Debby heading through the Washington, DC area triggered a rare tornado warning for the US Capitol complex.
The storm has left over 130,000 individuals without electricity due to tornado activity, which has also resulted in extensive structural damage.According to the National Hurricane Center , Debby made landfall early Thursday near Bulls Bay, South Carolina, initially as a Category 1 hurricane, leading to a temporary closure of a section of Interstate 95.
Three tornado warnings have been issued east of Raleigh, NC, as well as in Dortches and Rocky Mount.Debby continues to cause flooding in parts of eastern South Carolina and southeast North Carolina, with an additional 3 to 9 inches (8 to 23 centimeters) of rain possible as the storm moves north.
This raises concerns about flash floods in the mountainous areas of West Virginia.In response to the potential for severe thunderstorms from Debby, which the National Hurricane Center officially downgraded to a post-tropical cyclone, a tornado watch was issued for 17 New Jersey counties.
Additionally, the entire state was under a wind advisory, with anticipated gusts of up to 50 mph.
event_breakdown: Storm Debby through the east of the United States resulting in extensive flooding and a total of 181,000 homes being left without electricity as of Thursday evening.

title: Millions Facing Flood Threat As Debby Storms Up The East Coast
message:
Post-tropical storm Debby is spiraling up the Eastern Seaboard, posing a significant flood threat to millions of people from the Carolinas to New England.
Despite being downgraded from a tropical storm, Debby continues to cause severe weather conditions, including heavy rainfall, flash flooding, and the potential for tornadoes.
Debby has already caused extensive flooding in the Southeast, with river gauges reading high from Florida to New York.
In Moncks Corner, South Carolina, a Flash Flood Emergency was issued due to Debby, leading to evacuations and high-water rescues.
The heavy rain will fall on nearly saturated soils, leading to a substantial risk for flash flooding and river flooding in the Lake Champlain, Connecticut River, and Hudson River basins.

title: M5 . 3 earthquake hits Tokyo after Japan issued megaquake advisory
message:
TOKYO (Reuters) -A magnitude-5.3 earthquake hit Tokyo and eastern parts of Japan on Friday evening, the government said, a day after it issued the first-ever advisory about the risk of a huge earthquake in the west of the country.
The quake's epicentre was in the Kanagawa prefecture south next to the capital, at a depth of 10 km (6.2 miles), Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) said.
No tsunami alert was issued after the government sent strong tremor warnings for residents in Tokyo and prefectures of Kanagawa, Saitama, Yamanashi and Shizuoka.
Some train lines, including Central Japan Railway's Shinkansen high-speed rail services, stopped operations in regions near Tokyo and Kanagawa.
(Reporting by Satoshi Sugiyama, Kantaro Komiya, David Dolan, Mariko Katsumura and Rocky Swift; Editing by William Maclean and Helen Popper)
event_breakdown:
Location: off the coast of Fukushima, Japan
A Magnitude-5.3 earthquake rattled off the coast of Fukushima at 7:06 PM local Japan time today, according to the Japan Meteorological Agency. The Japan Meteorological Agency also reported that the epicenter for the earthquake was 13 miles off the coast at nearly 4.5 miles below the surface. The earthquake, however, was felt as far away as Tokyo. In Tokyo, the agency issued a strong tremor warning. The earthquake, with no reports of casualties or missing people so far, prompted no tsunami warning. The eastern region of the country is particularly seismically active. According to the Japan Meteorological Agency, the quake hit as the result of the Pacific Plate megathrust gliding westward about 2 to 3 centimeters annually.

message:

HOW TO WATCH FOX WEATHERThat data, the JMA said, includes a magnitude 7.0 earthquake that struck two days before a catastrophic magnitude 9.0 earthquake and Pacific-wide tsunami that rocked the region in March 2011.
This graphic shows information on the earthquake that struck Japan on Thursday, Aug. 8, 2024.
After the earthquake, scientists met to discuss the relationship between this quake and whether it had impacted the Nankai Trough, which sits about 560 miles offshore.
"The Japan Meteorological Agency will continue to carefully monitor the progress of crustal activity along the Nankai Trough."

title: The most hurricane - vulnerable counties in 2024
message:
Gage Goulding // ShutterstockThe most hurricane-vulnerable counties in 2024In November 2022, a month after Hurricane Ian hit FL, Fort Myers Beach still had piles of rubble alongshore.
With a hectic hurricane season forecasted for this summer, LawnStarter ranked 2024’s most hurricane-vulnerable counties.
County RankingsSee how the top 20 counties fared in our ranking:LawnStarterTop 5 Close UpTable showing the top 20 for “2024’s Most Hurricane-Vulnerable Counties”.
MethodologyFirst, we determined the factors (metrics) that are most relevant to rank the Most Hurricane-Vulnerable Counties.
We then assigned a weight to each factor based on its importance and grouped those factors into 4 categories: Hurricane Risk, Hurricane History, Financial Impact, and Disaster Cleanup.

message:

Trudy Schweb owns a fifth-generation ranch in the Hullcar area, directly below the Hullcar Mountain wildfire.
The past few days have been freaky for the family, though Schweb says she’s feeling better now.
The property is a ranch, and, thankfully, the family doesn’t have many cattle on their property right now.
The Hullcar Mountain wildfire remains burning out of control and has been classified as a wildfire of note by the BC Wildfire Service.

title: Japan PM Scraps Overseas Trip After  Megaquake  Advisory
message:
(MENAFN- The Peninsula) AFPTokyo: Prime Fumio Kishida on Friday cancelled a four-day trip to Central Asia after scientists warned Japan should prepare for a possible "megaquake".
Premier Kishida was due Friday to travel to Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan and Mongolia and attend a regional summit.
"As the prime minister with the highest responsibility for crisis management, I decided I should stay in Japan for at least a week," he told reporters.
He said the public must be feeling "very anxious" after the Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) issued its first advisory under a new system drawn up following a major magnitude 9.0 earthquake in 2011, which triggered a deadly tsunami and nuclear disaster.
"The likelihood of a new major earthquake is higher than normal, but this is not an indication that a major earthquake will definitely occur," the JMA said.
event_breakdown:
Japan
Premier Fumio Kishida on Friday cancelled a four-day trip to Central Asia after Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) warned Japan should prepare for a possible "megaquake".
